intro: Peltophorus forficulatus, commonly known as the common wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Oxalidaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Peltophorus forficulatus is known for its ability to grow in poor soil conditions and its rapid spread through rhizomes.
